item.title: Where Fortress Is Finding Opportunities in Real Estate
item.description: Josh Pack, Fortress Investment Group co-CEO and managing partner, and Tim Sloan, vice chair, discuss where they are finding opportunities in the commercial and residential real estate markets with Lisa Abramowicz on "Bloomberg The Close." (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Soy-Sauce Maker Foshan Haitian Starts Taking Orders for Up to $1.2 Billion Hong Kong IPO
item.description: Foshan Haitian Flavouring & Food Co. began taking investor orders for a Hong Kong initial public offering that could raise as much as HK$9.56 billion ($1.2 billion), the latest big listing powering the city’s share-sale recovery this year.
item.dc:creator: Dave Sebastian

media:content.media:description: Bottles of Foshan Haitian Flavoring & Food soy sauce in Beijing. Photographer: VCG/Getty Images

item.title: Asian Stocks to Track US Gains on Trade Talk Hopes: Markets Wrap
item.description: Stocks in Asia are set to follow gains on Wall Street as investors monitor trade discussions between the US and China that Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick said were “going really, really well.”
item.dc:creator: Rob Verdonck

media:content.media:description: US and Chinese flags in the entrance during trade talks at Lancaster House in London, UK, on Tuesday, June 10, 2025. Talks between the US and China extended later into their second day in London, with financial markets on edge as the world’s largest economies negotiate over key tech and industrial exports and deescalating their trade war.

item.title: US, Mexico Near Deal to Cut Steel Duties and Cap Imports
item.description: The US and Mexico are closing in on a deal that would remove President Donald Trump’s 50% tariffs on steel imports up to a certain volume, according to people familiar with the matter, a revamp of a similar deal between the trade partners during his first term. Trump hasn’t been directly involved in the negotiations and would need to sign off on any deal. The talks are being led by Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick, according to the people, who asked not to be identified as the discussions are private. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Wedbush's Pachter Weighs In on the Video Game Industry
item.description: Michael Pachter, Managing Director, Equity Research, Wedbush Securities, speaks with Alix Steel and Romaine Bostick about the AI in the video game industry. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: DWS Americas CEO on Geopolitics, Private Market Boom
item.description: Hepsen Uzcan, Americas CEO, DWS Group speaks with Romaine Bostick and Scarlet Fu about geopolitics and the private market boom. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Tariff Impact to Hit This Summer: JPMorgan Economist
item.description: Michael Feroli, Chief US Economist, JPMorgan speaks with Alix Steel and Romaine Bostick about consumer price index data coming tomorrow. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Argentina’s Top Court Bans Kirchner From Office for Life
item.description: Argentina’s Supreme Court upheld former President Cristina Fernandez de Kirchner’s fraud conviction, ratifying her sentence to six years in prison as well as a lifelong ban on holding public office, according to the court ruling reviewed by Bloomberg.
item.dc:creator: Manuela Tobias

media:content.media:description: Former Argentine President Cristina Fernandez de Kirchner

item.title: Bessent Says Trade Talks Ongoing, Departs for Washington
item.description: US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent tells reporters he has to return to Washington in order to testify before Congress. US Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick and US Trade Representative Jamieson Greer plan to continue discussions with their Chinese counterparts.

item.title: Trump’s Pick to Run CFTC Touts Work in Crypto to Lawmakers
item.description: Brian Quintenz, President Donald Trump’s pick to lead the US Commodity Futures Trading Commission, told lawmakers he is uniquely qualified to head the derivatives regulator as Congress considers giving it more authority over digital assets.
item.dc:creator: Nicola M White, Yash Roy

item.title: Fortress’s Pack and Sloan on Real Estate, Private Credit
item.description: Josh Pack, Fortress Investment Group co-CEO and managing partner, and Tim Sloan, vice chair, discuss the outlook for the commercial and residential real estate markets and where they are finding opportunities. Speaking with Lisa Abramowicz on “Bloomberg The Close,” Pack and Sloan also comment on recent trends in the private credit market.

item.title: EchoStar Bondholders Huddle With Law Firm Akin Gump as Default Looms
item.description: Bondholders to EchoStar Corp. are working with law firm Akin Gump Strauss Hauer & Feld and investment bank Centerview Partners LLC as the telecommunications company mulls a potential bankruptcy filing amid a Federal Communications Commission probe, according to people familiar with the matter.
item.dc:creator: Reshmi Basu, Eliza Ronalds-Hannon

media:content.media:description: A Dish satellite dish receiver at a home in Wrightwood, California.

item.title: Global Banks Scramble to Hire Top Talent in Booming Japan
item.description: In one of the world’s tightest labor markets, recruiters are cornering applicants in rooms for hours and wooing them with parties.
item.dc:creator: Lisa Du, Ambereen Choudhury, Takashi Nakamichi

item.title: Wall Street Wins More of Australia’s $2.7 Trillion Pension Pot
item.description: Australia’s pension funds are rapidly boosting their allocations to the heavyweights of US finance as rivalry heats up for access to the country’s A$4.1 trillion ($2.7 trillion) retirement pot.
item.dc:creator: Amy Bainbridge, Jinshan Hong

media:content.media:description: Pedestrians on Collins Street in Melbourne, Australia, on Friday, April 5, 2024. Australians have become some of the world’s wealthiest retirement savers in large part because the law that created the super funds also established a steady source of funding.

item.title: HSBC's Global Trade Outlook
item.description: Marissa Adams, Regional Head of Global Trade Solutions, Americas, HSBC, speaks with Romaine Bostick and Scarlet Fu about the global trade outlook. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: S&P 500 Gains as Lutnick Signals US-China Progress
item.description: Wall Street investors closely monitoring trade discussions between the US and China drove stocks higher as Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick said negotiations went really, really well. Treasuries and the dollar saw small moves ahead of a key inflation report.
item.dc:creator: Rita Nazareth

item.title: Bitcoin Pulls Back After Latest Push Toward Record Falls Short
item.description: Bitcoin retreated from the highs of the day after an earlier push toward the record price level set a little more than two weeks ago fell short.
item.dc:creator: Kirk Ogunrinde

item.title: Traders Boost Bets on Just One 2025 Fed Cut Ahead of CPI Data
item.description: Traders are increasingly betting that the Federal Reserve will cut interest rates only once this year amid signs of resilient growth and sticky inflation.
item.dc:creator: Edward Bolingbroke

item.title: NJ Transit Engineers Union Votes in Favor of New Wage Agreement
item.description: New Jersey Transit’s locomotive engineers ratified the new wage contract which was the result of an agreement following a three-day strike that halted rail service in May.
item.dc:creator: Sri Taylor

media:content.media:description: Members of the Brotherhood of Locomotive Engineers and Trainmen picket outside of the Hoboken Terminal during a strike in Hoboken, New Jersey, US, on Friday, May 16, 2025. New Jersey Transit locomotive engineers started striking early Friday, triggering a shutdown of the agency's rail service and disrupting travel for thousands of commuters.

item.title: Risk of Aluminum Squeeze Grows as Key Price Spread Tightens
item.description: A key aluminum spread that’s been the focus of recent intervention by the London Metal Exchange surged into backwardation, signaling the LME market may still be at risk of a squeeze as the main June contract expires next week.
item.dc:creator: Jack Farchy

item.title: US Stocks Rise for Third Day as Lutnick Hints at Trade Progress
item.description: The S&P 500 Index closed within striking distance of an all-time high after Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick said trade negotiations between Washington and Beijing went “really, really well.”
item.dc:creator: Jess Menton

media:content.media:description: Traders work on the floor of the New York Stock Exchange.

item.title: Ascend to Pay Up to $2.46 Million in Bankruptcy Bonuses to Executives
item.description: Ascend Performance Materials Inc., a bankrupt maker of industrial nylon, won court permission to pay 11 executives a total of as much $2.46 million in bonuses as the company works to cut debt and reorganize itself while in court protection.
item.dc:creator: Steven Church

media:content.media:description: An operator works at the Ascend Performance Materials Chocolate Bayou Plant in Alvin, Texas.

item.title: Pimco Favors 5- to 10-Year Bonds, Is Cautious on Private Credit
item.description: Pacific Investment Management Co. expects to favor global bonds due in 5 to 10 years and be underweight long-maturity debt over the next half-decade, while treading carefully in private credit as weaker growth threatens lower-quality companies, according to the $2 trillion asset manager’s latest annual secular outlook.
item.dc:creator: Michael Mackenzie

media:content.media:description: Richard Clarida of Pacific Investment Management Co.

item.title: McDonald’s Shares Slip as GLP-1 Risks Spur Rare Sell Rating
item.description: McDonald’s Corp. shares slipped on Tuesday after Redburn Atlantic gave the burger chain its sole sell rating, saying shifting consumer patterns due to weight-loss drugs and inflation are cause for concern.
item.dc:creator: Monique Mulima

item.title: Agents Are the Next Wave of AI: Notable’s Solomon
item.description: Glenn Solomon, managing partner at Notable Capital, says AI agents are filling entry-level roles. Solomon discusses how his firm supports its startups on "Bloomberg Tech" with Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Carlyle's Bernasek Expects Better Second Half for PE
item.description: Brian Bernasek, Carlyle's co-head of private equity Americas, says he is bullish on the private equity market and discusses where the company is seeing opportunities amid market certainty on "Bloomberg The Close." (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: NASA Has Options Besides Musk, ULA’s CEO Says
item.description: Tory Bruno, CEO of United Launch Alliance, says US launch capabilities would be fine in the long term if Elon Musk’s SpaceX stops providing rides for astronauts in Dragon. Bruno explains what ULA’s capabilities are with Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow on “Bloomberg Tech.” (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Evergreen Residential to Manage 21,000 Single-Family Rentals for VineBrook
item.description: Evergreen Residential Holdings is taking over management of 21,000 US rental homes owned by VineBrook Homes Trust Inc., as single-family landlords find new ways to grow at a time when acquisitions are difficult.
item.dc:creator: Patrick Clark

item.title: Uber and Wayve Plan UK Self-Driving Trial
item.description: Uber and SoftBank-Backed Wayve’s plans for driverless car trials in the UK are missing key hardware players, according to BloombergNEF Intelligent Mobility Analyst Andrew Grant. He joins Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow on “Bloomberg Tech.” (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: US-China Takls Ongoing | Bloomberg Markets 6/10/2025
item.description: "Bloomberg Markets" follows the market moves across every global asset class and discusses the biggest issues for Wall Street. On the show today Wilmer Cutler Pickering Hale and Dorr LLP Partner, American Enterprise Institute Nonresident Fellow Neena Shenai. (Source: Bloomberg)
